shortdesc.i: Task types were defined to ease understanding their business nature. From the business point of view we may divide all possible tasks into separate domains: Functional Tasks and Product tasks. Tasks are divided into types within each domain and may be divided into subtypes.

body.p: Functional Tasks domain comprises all banking tasks, that bank employees and their clients handle using DB Solution software. Moreover this domain comprises all tasks that have to be done to install and maintenance DB Solution software. Functional domain tasks are divided into seven types, each task type may have subtypes. Example, Functional tasks/Business tasks/Payment tasks/...

serves to fulfil tasks that have to do with software maintenance operations like: version updating, scaling, running backups, performing health checks.

body.p: Product Tasks domain comprises all tasks that enterprise handle to design, produce, sale, deliver and putting its products to use. Product domain tasks are divided into four types. Product task types are associated with enterprise processes. Each task type may have subtypes.

Product tasks:
Onboarding tasks Tasks that have to do with company's employees onboarding processes. These processes will be different, based on the specific employee's role.
Sales tasks Tasks that are being held by the Sales department.
Project implementation tasks Tasks from different stages of project implementation process.
Client support tasks
Specific tasks to provide a customer with support regarding their DB solution.
